abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as satisfactory. The main lessons learned from the
            project include: 1) Tariffs need to be set at sustainable
            levels. 2) Community participation in the various phases of
            the project is essential for the success and long-term
            sustainability of the project. 3) National Environmental
            Sanitation Services (SENASA) should make a sustained effort
            to collect the payments on the loans to the Juntas (a
            community organization). 4) SENASA should make increased use
            of alternative technologies and apply lower cost and
            appropriate solutions. 5) SENASA should strengthen its
            hygiene education activities to ensure that sanitation needs
            are adequately addressed. 6) SENASA should transform itself
            from an agency doing the works to one that facilitates the
            construction of systems. 7) SENASA should modernize its
            internal information systems. 8) Financing of water meters
            should be offered in the loans for Juntas (a community
            organization). 9) The provision of water and sanitation to
            the rural areas lends itself to the use of the Bank's
            "Adaptable Program Lending" instrument.
